select sum(sub_price) s_sales, sub_c_no, c_name, count(*) s_count from subscribe s left join (select * from content) c on sub_c_no = c_no
where c_level = #{c_level} group by sub_c_no order by s_sales desc

SELECT date_range.date_range AS s_date, IFNULL(COUNT(subscribe.sub_date), 0) AS s_count, IFNULL(ROUND(SUM(subscribe.sub_price), 0), 0) AS s_sales FROM ( SELECT DATE_ADD(#{startdate}, INTERVAL n DAY) AS date_range FROM ( SELECT a.N + b.N * 10 + c.N * 100 AS n FROM ( SELECT 0 AS N UNION ALL SELECT 1 UNION ALL SELECT 2 UNION ALL SELECT 3 UNION ALL SELECT 4 UNION ALL SELECT 5 UNION ALL SELECT 6 UNION ALL SELECT 7 UNION ALL SELECT 8 UNION ALL SELECT 9 ) AS a CROSS JOIN ( SELECT 0 AS N UNION ALL SELECT 1 UNION ALL SELECT 2 UNION ALL SELECT 3 UNION ALL SELECT 4 UNION ALL SELECT 5 UNION ALL SELECT 6 UNION ALL SELECT 7 UNION ALL SELECT 8 UNION ALL SELECT 9 ) AS b CROSS JOIN ( SELECT 0 AS N UNION ALL SELECT 1 UNION ALL SELECT 2 UNION ALL SELECT 3 UNION ALL SELECT 4 UNION ALL SELECT 5 UNION ALL SELECT 6 UNION ALL SELECT 7 UNION ALL SELECT 8 UNION ALL SELECT 9 ) AS c ) AS numbers WHERE DATE_ADD(#{startdate}, INTERVAL n DAY) BETWEEN #{startdate} AND #{enddate} ) AS date_range LEFT JOIN subscribe ON DATE(date_range.date_range) = DATE(subscribe.sub_date) GROUP BY date_range.date_range
